required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Interaction Between SSP-004184 (SPD602) and Midazolam in Healthy Adult Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Open Label, Crossover Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetic Interaction Between SSP-004184 (SPD602) and Midazolam in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: A Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetic Interaction Between SSP-004184 and Midazolam in Healthy Adult Subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From Time Zero to Infinity (AUCinf) of Midazolam
primary_outcome.description: AUCinf is the area under the plasma concentration versus time curve extrapolated from time 0 to infinity, calculated using the observed value of the last non-zero concentration. AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Measureable Concentration (AUClast) of Midazolam
primary_outcome.description: AUClast is the area under the concentration versus time curve from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration. AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.

arm_group.description: Administered as a single oral 6 mg dose on Day 1.
Midazolam (6 mg) + SSP-004184SS (30 mg/kg) concomitantly administered as a single oral dose on Day 1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal healthy male and female volunteers between the ages of 18 and 65, inclusive
- Serum ferritin, hemoglobin and erythrocyte indices within normal range
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of any active or chronic disease

group.title: Midazolam First
group.description: Subjects received Midazolam 6mg in Period 1, followed by Midazolam 6mg and SSP-004184SS 30mg/kg during Period 2.

group.title: Midazolam + SSP-004184SS First
group.description: Subjects received Midazolam 6mg and SSP-004184SS 30mg/kg in Period 1, followed by Midazolam 6mg during Period 2.

group.title: Midazolam First
group.description: Subjects received Midazolam 6mg in Period 1, followed by Midazolam 6mg and SSP-004184SS 30mg/kg during Period 2.

group.title: Midazolam + SSP-004184SS First
group.description: Subjects received Midazolam 6mg and SSP-004184SS 30mg/kg in Period 1, followed by Midazolam 6mg during Period 2.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From Time Zero to Infinity (AUCinf) of Midazolam
outcome.description: AUCinf is the area under the plasma concentration versus time curve extrapolated from time 0 to infinity, calculated using the observed value of the last non-zero concentration. AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Set: All subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

group.title: Midazolam
group.description: Administered as a single oral 6 mg dose on Day 1.

group.title: SSP-004184SS + Midazolam
group.description: Midazolam (6 mg) + SSP-004184SS (30 mg/kg) concomitantly administered as a single oral dose on Day 1.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) From Time Zero to Infinity (AUCinf) of Midazolam
measure.description: AUCinf is the area under the plasma concentration versus time curve extrapolated from time 0 to infinity, calculated using the observed value of the last non-zero concentration. AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Set: All subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

analysis.groups_desc: The means of the log-transformed pharmacokinetic parameters were compared between treatments using a mixed-effects model with period and treatment as fixed effects and subject nested within sequence as a random effect. In order to estimate the magnitude of the treatment regimen differences in AUCinf, the geometric mean ratio (i.e., the least squares mean difference in the log-transformed parameters back transformed to the original scale) and their 90% CIs were calculated.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: If the 90% CI of the geometric mean ratios were within the range (0.80, 1.25), then equivalence was assumed and the hypothesis that a drug interaction occurred was rejected. If the 90% CIs were not wholly contained within the range (0.80, 1.25), then a drug interaction was not excluded.
analysis.estimate_desc: The ratio of geometric LS means and 90% CIs for the geometric mean ratio is for Treatment B to Treatment A.

outcome.title: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Measureable Concentration (AUClast) of Midazolam
outcome.description: AUClast is the area under the concentration versus time curve from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration. AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Set: All subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

group.description: Administered as a single oral 6 mg dose on Day 1.

measure.title: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Measureable Concentration (AUClast) of Midazolam
measure.description: AUClast is the area under the concentration versus time curve from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration. AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Set: All subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

analysis.groups_desc: The means of the log-transformed pharmacokinetic parameters were compared between treatments using a mixed-effects model with period and treatment as fixed effects, and subject nested within sequence as a random effect. In order to estimate the magnitude of the treatment regimen differences in AUClast, the geometric mean ratio (i.e., the least squares mean difference in the log-transformed parameters back transformed to the original scale) and their 90% CIs were calculated.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: If the 90% CI of the geometric mean ratios fell within the range (0.80, 1.25), then equivalence was assumed and the hypothesis that a drug interaction occurred was rejected. If the 90% CIs were not wholly contained within the range (0.80, 1.25), then a drug interaction was not excluded.
analysis.estimate_desc: The ratio of geometric LS means and 90% CIs for the geometric mean ratio is for Treatment B to Treatment A.

outcome.description: Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Midazolam
measure.description: Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Set: All subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

analysis.groups_desc: The means of the log-transformed pharmacokinetic parameters were compared between treatments using a mixed-effects model with period and treatment as fixed effects, and subject nested within sequence as a random effect. In order to estimate the magnitude of the treatment regimen differences in Cmax, the geometric mean ratio (i.e., the least squares mean difference in the log-transformed parameters back transformed to the original scale) and their 90% CIs were calculated.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: If the 90% CI of the geometric mean ratios fell within the range (0.80, 1.25), then equivalence was assumed and the hypothesis that a drug interaction occurred was rejected. If the 90% CIs were not wholly contained within the range (0.80, 1.25), then a drug interaction was not excluded.
analysis.estimate_desc: The ratio of geometric LS means and 90% CIs for the geometric mean ratio is for Treatment B to Treatment A.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
